title: Liverpool goalkeeper Alisson nowhere to be seen after his name is read out for FIFA goalkeeper award
text:
Liverpool goalkeeper Alisson was initially nowhere to be seen when he was announced as the winner of the FIFA Best Men’s Goalkeeper award on Monday night.

In a bizarre incident, Alisson's name was read out at the FIFA Best Awards in Milan but stars including his manager Jurgen Klopp and ex-England boss Fabio Capello were left looking around the room in bemusement as he failed to emerge.

Dutch legend Ruud Gullit, one of the presenters at the ceremony, said: 'Hello, where is Allison Becker? Where is Becker?

Alisson was nowhere to be seen after being announced as the FIFA Best Men's Goalkeeper

Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp looked bemused at Allison's absence, as did Fabio Capello

'I saw him before, where are you? Are you hiding?'

When Alisson finally emerged, Gullit turned to co-presenter Ilaria D'Amico and said: 'You have to say it in Brazilian, in the Brazilian language. Or he did not expect to win.'

Eventually, the Brazil international did take to the stage, saying: 'Sorry, it's not my fault'.

Alisson was eventually spotted, with the Brazil international making his way to the stage

After finally receiving the award, Alisson apologised but added 'It's not my fault'

In addition to receiving the best goalkeeper award, Alisson was also named in the FIFA FIFPro men's team of the year along with his Liverpool team-mate Virgil van Dijk.

Alisson enjoyed a superb first season at Liverpool as he helped Jurgen Klopp's side to win the Champions League, while he also produced some excellent displays in the Premier League.

The 26-year-old is currently out injured having suffered a calf problem against Norwich in the opening game of the Premier League season.
